Start: ^You are the leader of the fairy people.
^You and 2000 fairies have fled your homes as large, clumsy beings cut down the forests and destroyed your land.

g-0: ^You have brought with you meager resources that can be used to build a new colony in this new, unknown land.
^Hover the mouse over the resources (top of the screen) to learn more about them.
g-1: ^Remember! Fairies like to collect stories, so if you find those that can tell you stories about this new land you will find an easier time making a home here.

Encounter_Well_A_Voice_In_The_Well: ^You approach the well curious about what it may hide.
^"WHO GOES THERE AND WHAT HAVE YOU FOR ME?!" a voice echoes from below.
^Offer the voice a gift as an apology

c-0: ^"I CARE NOT FOR YOU FEY CREATURE!"
^Tell the voice fun stories about fairy life
^Offer the voice a gift as an apology

Nope: ^You decide it's time to leave the voice alone.
Happy: ^Satisfied with this encounter you decide it's time to go.
Gift: ^"A GIFT YOU SAY? I LIKE GIFTS!"

c-0: ^Yuck! I hate these things! Go away!

s1: ^"Another coin, how original!? I hope you made a wish!"
^And with that the voice goes silent.
s2: ^"Well, if you are going to be so generous I guess I can repay the favor. Let me tell you a story."

s0: ^"Ugh, you throw in trash! Be off with you!" With that the voice goes silent.
s1: ^You hear nothing more from the voice.

FeyStories: ^You recount several fun stories about fairy games, tricking cats into falling off surfaces and other exciting things.

s0: ^Oooh, what wonderful stories! Thank you for sharing. You must let me tell you a story of my own.
s1: ^"ARGH! WHY are you so TEDIOUS! BEGONE!""

Sludge: ^A furious roar erupts from the well followed by a torrent of hot, black sludge being shot into the air!
^ fairies are burned to death by the disgusting liquid.

Encounter_Well_A_Lovers_Well: ^You approach a well covered in markings. On closer inspection many of them are the initials of lovers etched into the stone, often surrounded by a heart.
^Etch the initials of two fairies in love

s1: ^A burbling sound comes up, but then silence.
s2: ^A mass of butterflies fly up from the well.
s3: ^A bat flies out of the well.

Encounter_Well_A_Boarded_Up_Well: ^You approach a well that has been boarded up. There is a wood covering over the top and a metal bar to hold it in place.
^In fact it's even locked with a padlock!
^Sprinkle a few pinches of fairy dust onto it (-3 fairy dust)
^Leave it alone and explore the area

c-0: ^ You try and try but the lock is too difficult to pick.
c-1: ^ You try and try and try but you are tiny creatures, strength is not your strong suit.

s0: ^A deep, thunderous boom comes from inside the the well. Then the clouds begin to darken and you hear thunder in the distance.
^You flee the well but soon a swarm of massive insects arrive and attack your fairies!
s1: ^You open the well but there is nothing inside other than a nasty stench.
s2: ^You open the well and it's completely dry but there is a skeleton of a very large animal inside.

GainFairy: ^A fairy flies out of the well. "Thank you for saving me!" the tiny voice squeaks.
^Happily your new friend accepts your invitation to join the colony. Is is fairy custom an exchange of stories takes place.

Encounter_Tree_Giant_Boulder: ^As you pass through the forest you discover a massive boulder in the middle of a grove. It is quiet and nothing large grows near it.

s0: ^It's a nondescript boulder. The fairies get bored.
s1: ^The boulder hums with a magic energy. What type of magic is unclear.
^Perform a divination ritual to learn more (-1 coin)
s2: ^The boulder provides shade for a friendly chipmunk. She plays with one of the fairies for a bit before going on her way.

Ritual: ^33 fairies sit in a circle and chant words of ancient fey magic. The coin disappears and the fairies go into a deep trance.

s0: ^One speaks "this is a blessed stone, placed here by those that love the forest. It will bring fortune to a colony should we choose to found one nearby."
s1: ^One speaks "this stone traps a vile, evil creature. This place is cursed, we should leave."
s2: ^One speaks "this stone has shared its wisdow. It has sat here for so long and seen so many things."
^With newfound knowledge of the area your fairies discover a hidden cache of
s3: ^A look of horror covers the face of one of the fairies. "NO! This stone is evil!"
^Dark, shadowy hands reach up from the ground and start grabbing the fairies and pulling them under the earth.

Encounter_Ruins_Old_Battlefield: ^ you discover the remains of an old battleground. Rusted remains of weapons and armor lie around you.

s0: ^Your fairies look around but find nothing interesting.
s2: ^Your fairies look around and discover a mouse playing with a shiny arrowhead.

g-0: ^ While looking around an a fairy discovers an angry snake as is immediately devoured!
^ While looking around your fairies stumble upon a wolf! Chaos ensues and

Mouse: ^Offer to trade the arrowhead for a story
^Offer to trade the arrowhead for a feyberry

s0: ^"No thank you" says the mouse and it scurries away.
s1: ^"Sure thing, I love stories!" The mouse gives you the arrowhead and you proceed to tell him a story.

c-1: ^ Ooh, I love berries! The mouse agrees to the trade.

s0: ^"No" says the mouse. "I gave you the arrow head, we're even." He scurries away.

Encounter_General_A_Feast_for_Valor: ^ you discover a feast is going an around it. There are so many visitors - rabbits wearing their best suits, toads in tophats and mice wearing nice coats.
^Leave the feast alone and explore the area

c-1: ^ You decide this is not productive to founding a colony.

Introduction: ^You walk up to the feast and introduce yourself

s0: ^The feast fades away. It was all an illusion! You scramble to escape whatever trap this is but
s1: ^A very self-impressed rabbit walks up to you. "You are not welcome here! Begone with you."
s2: ^You are welcome to join the feast. Your fairies have a great time feasting with their new friends.
^Thank them and be on your way

c-1: ^ You thank them for the wonder time and go on your way.

Berries: ^The guests are excited to try the feyberries.

s0: ^They love them and start behaving very strangely.
^Before long they start greedily staring at your pouches asking more and more questions about how many berries you have left.
^You decide to escape while you still have the chance.
s1: ^You try to escape before things get out of control but chaos ensues! They try to steal your berries!
^They love them and start getting happy and nostalgic. One of them offers to tell you a story.
^ fairies are lost in the struggle!
s2: ^You barely escape! It seems not everybody can handle their feyberries.

s0: ^Approaching the area you run into a fox. It pops out of a hole in the ground right in the middle of your fairies.
^Throw food at the fox and run away! -10 feyberries
s1: ^Approaching the area you see a fox nearby. It doesn't seem to have noticed you. Foxes are very dangerous and known to eat fairies.
^Leave some food so it won't follow us and sneak away
^Send two fairies to lure him away while the rest escape
^The fox notices you and changes right for the nearest fairies!
^The fox notices you and the berries but decides the berries are less trouble to eat.
s2: ^The fox notices you and changes right for the nearest fairies!

b: ^The distraction is successful and all the fairies escape.
^The fox is quick and leaps into the air chomping one of the fairies.
^The distraction is successful but the two fairies were never seen again.

s2: ^As you approach the area a fox leaps out at you and charges your fairies!

s0: ^but the fairies are too fast and manage to escape! What luck.
s1: ^ fairies before the rest can escape.

FoxChomp: ^The fox catches up with the fairies and manages to catch and kill
Escape: ^What a relief, you managed to get away!

MaybeSettleHere: ^If you decide this is where the colony should live it will end the game.

DoSettlementBuilding: ^Your fairies start building a new colony using the magic dust to keep the construction hidden.

^Your tiny population prevents your colony from reaching it's potential.
^Your very small numbers result in significant setbacks developing and growing the colony.
^Your smaller numbers hold back the colony's development.
^Your reduced numbers makes it more difficult for your fairy colony to flourish.
^Your reduced numbers slightly hinder your colony's growth.
^Your tiny feytree orchard makes survival your colony's primary goal.
^Your very small feytree orchard means your colony is mostly focused on its basic needs.
^Your limited feytree orchard means there is enough food to go around but none is ever traded and some fairies get more than others.
^Your ample feytree orchard means all eat well.
^Your excellent abundance of fruit means you have many great feasts and sometimes give berries to your friends.
^Your incredible abundance of feyberry fruit enables many feasts, celebrations and donations to friends.
^The dream of this fairy colony is short lived. The attempt to build a colony failed and what fairies were left quickly became disillusioned with their fate.
^The hope for a stable, long-lasting new home fails and before too long the colony completely disbands.

^The colony mostly keeps to itself. The world never learns about the colony other than a few lucky fey that happen upon it.

^The colony survives but never truly flourishes and the fairies always dream of the better life they had to leave behind.

^Some art and music is created by the colony but it's only enjoyed by few.

^The colony is stable and takes care of itself. A strong hierarchy appears as some fairies become more powerful and "important" than others.

^Over time some fairies venture out to create new settlements but they are small and don't expand far.

^The colony creates some beautiful works of art, music and writing which are enjoyed by fairy and fey alike. Most fairies say the life they live in this new land is neither better nor worse than in the old land, only different.

^The colony is very prosperous and grows in strengh and identity.

^Most fairies lead either very impactful and appreciated lives for the colony or they create beautiful works of art which are enjoyed by fey all over the land.

^Eventually the life left behind is forgotten.

^The colony thrives to such an amazing degree that none miss the old life they had to leave behind.

^So much amazing art, music and writing are created that creatures come for far and wide to enjoy the delights of the colony.

DoSettlementQoL: ^Fairies are happiest in large numbers with many shiny trinkets to play with. Numbers bring about a strong sense of safety and community.

b:
^Your colony is very unhappy. Jealousy, pettiness and greed rule the day with many fairies becoming surly and mean.

^Over time the colony turns into a "dark fey" colony befriending the spiders, snakes, and tricksters of the land. The culture created by the colony brings melancholy to those that consume it and all that know your fairies feel great despair.

^The colony is a nervous one with many fairies feeling paranoid that they could be eaten or have their meager possessions taken from them.

^Trinkets are horded and often stolen. Their value is mostly lost as guarding them becomes more important than playing with them.

^The colony lives an honest life with most feeling safe in their new home. Some fairies are discontent but most go about their day playing game with trinkets, befriending visiting animals and leading decent lives.

^A few fairies thrive in this environment and are known as the "greatest of us", they are the ones creating the best art and the most fun games. Most live their lives a little bit envious of them.

^The colony is a very happy one. Most fairies have found their lives fulfilling and most spend their time doing what brings them the most satisfaction.

^Many create art, many farm the feyberry trees, some simply play with their animal friends for most of the days.

^The colony is a thriving paragon of happiness and creative satisfaction. Every fairy has found their true joys in life and spend most of their energy pursuing them.

^Maintenance tasks are turned into fun games.

^The fairies all call each other "friend" and conflict inside the colony is unheard of.

s0: ^You hear a wonderful story about the animals of the land
^You hear a wonderful story about the plants of the land
^You hear a wonderful story about the magic of the land
^You hear a wonderful story about the beauty of the land
